intro: Hieracium pugsleyi, commonly known as the Pugsley's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium pugsleyi is often found in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
